answerTexts: Biology An aggregation of morphologically similar cells and associated intercellular matter acting together to perform one or more specific functions in the body. There are four basic types of tissue: muscle, nerve, epidermal, and connective.
The food-conducting tissue of vascular plants, consisting of sieve tubes, fibers, parenchyma, and sclereids. Also called bast.
Botany The layer of cutin covering the epidermis of the aerial parts of plants.
The outer, protective, nonvascular layer of the skin of vertebrates, covering the dermis.
